byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Tampa, Fla.; Hwaida Saad from Beirut; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

abstract: Three terror attacks, perpetrated on three continents within three hours, seem to be linked only by purpose of causing substantial numbers of civilian deaths and timing of attacks, which some say indicate level of coordination; Islamic State is claiming responsibility for attacks on tourist beach in Tunisia and at mosque in Kuwait, while assailant behind assault on American-owned chemical plant in France remains unclear.
lead_paragraph: An American-owned plant was attacked in France, a beach resort was struck in Tunisia, and ISIS claimed responsibility for a suicide bombing at a Kuwait mosque.

headline.main: Terrorist Attacks in France, Tunisia and Kuwait Kill Dozens
headline.print_headline: Attacks on 3 Continents Expose Global Hurdles in Terror Fight

snippet: An American-owned plant was attacked in France, a beach resort was struck in Tunisia, and ISIS claimed responsibility for a suicide bombing at a Kuwait mosque.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
